              # well as handling the creation of <tt>ActiveRecord::Base</tt>-like

              #

              # The requirements to implement <tt>ActiveModel::AttributeMethods</tt> are to:
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

              # * <tt>include ActiveModel::AttributeMethods</tt> in your class.
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

              # * Call each of its methods you want to add, such as +attribute_method_suffix+
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

              #   or +attribute_method_prefix+.
          
      29.

              # * Call +define_attribute_methods+ after the other methods are called.

              # * Define the various generic +_attribute+ methods that you have declared.
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

              # * Define an +attributes+ method which returns a hash with each
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

              #   attribute name in your model as hash key and the attribute value as hash value.

                  def attribute_method_prefix(*prefixes)

    109.

            1
            

            

                  def attribute_method_suffix(*suffixes)
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            27
            

            

                    self.attribute_method_matchers += suffixes.map! { |suffix| AttributeMethodMatcher.new suffix: suffix }
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            8
            

            

                    undefine_attribute_methods
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

            
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                  # Declares a method available for all attributes with the given prefix
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  # and suffix. Uses +method_missing+ and <tt>respond_to?</tt> to rewrite
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                  # the method.
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                  #   #{prefix}#{attr}#{suffix}(*args, &block)
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                  # to
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                  #   #{prefix}attribute#{suffix}(#{attr}, *args, &block)
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  # An <tt>#{prefix}attribute#{suffix}</tt> instance method must exist and
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                  # accept at least the +attr+ argument.
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Person
          
      162.

                  def attribute_method_affix(*affixes)

                    self.attribute_method_matchers += affixes.map! { |affix| AttributeMethodMatcher.new prefix: affix[:prefix], suffix: affix[:suffix] }
          
      181.

            4
            

            

                    undefine_attribute_methods

                  def alias_attribute(new_name, old_name)
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            4
            

            

                    self.attribute_aliases = attribute_aliases.merge(new_name.to_s => old_name.to_s)
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            4
            

            

                    CodeGenerator.batch(self, __FILE__, __LINE__) do |owner|
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            4
            

            

                      attribute_method_matchers.each do |matcher|
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            4
            

            

                        matcher_new = matcher.method_name(new_name).to_s
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            4
            

            

                        matcher_old = matcher.method_name(old_name).to_s
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            4
            

            

                        define_proxy_call false, owner, matcher_new, matcher_old
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

            
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                  # Is +new_name+ an alias?
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            1
            

            

                  def attribute_alias?(new_name)
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                    attribute_aliases.key? new_name.to_s
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

            
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns the original name for the alias +name+
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            1
            

            

                  def attribute_alias(name)
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

                    attribute_aliases[name.to_s]
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

            
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

                  # Declares the attributes that should be prefixed and suffixed by
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>ActiveModel::AttributeMethods</tt>.
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

                  # To use, pass attribute names (as strings or symbols). Be sure to declare
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

                  # +define_attribute_methods+ after you define any prefix, suffix or affix
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            
            

            

                  # methods, or they will not hook in.
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Person
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

                  #     include ActiveModel::AttributeMethods
          
      238.

      239.

                  #     attr_accessor :name, :age, :address

    241. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

                  #     # Call to define_attribute_methods must appear after the
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

                  #     # attribute_method_prefix, attribute_method_suffix or
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

                  #     # attribute_method_affix declarations.
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

                  #     define_attribute_methods :name, :age, :address
          
      246.

                  #
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

                  #     private
          
      248.

                  #
          
      249.

                  #       send("#{attr}=", nil)
          
      251.

                  #     end
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            1
            

            

                  def define_attribute_methods(*attr_names)
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            9
            

            

                    CodeGenerator.batch(generated_attribute_methods, __FILE__, __LINE__) do |owner|
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            23
            

            

                      attr_names.flatten.each { |attr_name| define_attribute_method(attr_name, _owner: owner) }
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

            
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

                  # Declares an attribute that should be prefixed and suffixed by
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>ActiveModel::AttributeMethods</tt>.
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            
            

            

                  # To use, pass an attribute name (as string or symbol). Be sure to declare
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            
            

            

                  # +define_attribute_method+ after you define any prefix, suffix or affix
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            
            

            

                  # method, or they will not hook in.
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Person

                  #     include ActiveModel::AttributeMethods

                  #     # attribute_method_prefix, attribute_method_suffix or
          
      274.

                  #     # attribute_method_affix declarations.

                  #     define_attribute_method :name

                  #

                  #   person = Person.new
          
      285.

                  #   person.name = 'Bob'
          
      286. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    286. 
            
            

            

                  #   person.name        # => "Bob"
          
      287. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    287. 
            
            

            

                  #   person.name_short? # => true
          
      288. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    288. 
            1
            

            

                  def define_attribute_method(attr_name, _owner: generated_attribute_methods)
          
      289. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    289. 
            29
            

            

                    CodeGenerator.batch(_owner, __FILE__, __LINE__) do |owner|
          
      290. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    290. 
            29
            

            

                      attribute_method_matchers.each do |matcher|
          
      291. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    291. 
            105
            

            

                        method_name = matcher.method_name(attr_name)
          
      292. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    292. 
            
            

            

            
          
      293. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    293. 
            105
            

            

                        unless instance_method_already_implemented?(method_name)
          
      294. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    294. 
            104
            

            

                          generate_method = "define_method_#{matcher.target}"
          
      295. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    295. 
            
            

            

            
          
      296. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    296. 
            104
            

            

                          if respond_to?(generate_method, true)
          
      297. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    297. 
            10
            

            

                            send(generate_method, attr_name.to_s, owner: owner)
          
      298. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    298. 
            
            

            

                          else
          
      299. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    299. 
            94
            

            

                            define_proxy_call true, owner, method_name, matcher.target, attr_name.to_s
          
      300. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    300. 
            
            

            

                          end
          
      301. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    301. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      302. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    302. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      303. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    303. 
            29
            

            

                      attribute_method_matchers_cache.clear
          
      304. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    304. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      305. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    305. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      306. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    306. 
            
            

            

            
          
      307. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    307. 
            
            

            

                  # Removes all the previously dynamically defined methods from the class.
          
      308. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    308. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      309. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    309. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Person
          
      310. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    310. 
            
            

            

                  #     include ActiveModel::AttributeMethods
          
      311. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    311. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            
            

            

                  #     attr_accessor :name
          
      313. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    313. 
            
            

            

                  #     attribute_method_suffix '_short?'
          
      314. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    314. 
            
            

            

                  #     define_attribute_method :name
          
      315. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    315. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      316. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    316. 
            
            

            

                  #     private
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            
            

            

                  #     def attribute_short?(attr)
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            
            

            

                  #       send(attr).length < 5
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            
            

            

                  #     end
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    323. 
            
            

            

                  #   person = Person.new
          
      324. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    324. 
            
            

            

                  #   person.name = 'Bob'
          
      325. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    325. 
            
            

            

                  #   person.name_short? # => true
          
      326. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    326. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      327. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    327. 
            
            

            

                  #   Person.undefine_attribute_methods
          
      328. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    328. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      329. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    329. 
            
            

            

                  #   person.name_short? # => NoMethodError
          
      330. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    330. 
            1

                    class CodeGenerator

                        def batch(owner, path, line)

            42
            

            

                          if owner.is_a?(CodeGenerator)
          
      342.

            14
            

            

                            yield owner
          
      343.

      344.

            28

            28

                      def execute
          
      369.

            28
            

            

                        @owner.module_eval(@sources.join(";"), @path, @line - 1)
          
      370. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    370. 
            28

                          @owner.alias_method new_name, old_name

      373.

                    def generated_attribute_methods
          
      379.

                      @generated_attribute_methods ||= Module.new.tap { |mod| include mod }
          
      380.

                    def instance_method_already_implemented?(method_name)
          
      383.

            105
            

            

                      generated_attribute_methods.method_defined?(method_name)
          
      384. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    384. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      385. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    385. 
            
            

            

            
          
      386. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    386. 
            
            

            

                    # The methods +method_missing+ and +respond_to?+ of this module are
          
      387. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    387. 
            
            

            

                    # invoked often in a typical rails, both of which invoke the method
          
      388. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    388. 
            
            

            

                    # +matched_attribute_method+. The latter method iterates through an
          
      389. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    389. 
            
            

            

                    # array doing regular expression matches, which results in a lot of
          
      390. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    390. 
            
            

            

                    # object creations. Most of the time it returns a +nil+ match. As the
          
      391. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    391. 
            
            

            

                    # match result is always the same given a +method_name+, this cache is
          
      392. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    392. 
            
            

            

                    # used to alleviate the GC, which ultimately also speeds up the app
          
      393. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    393. 
            
            

            

                    # significantly (in our case our test suite finishes 10% faster with
          
      394. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    394. 
            
            

            

                    # this cache).
          
      395. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    395. 
            1
            

            

                    def attribute_method_matchers_cache
          
      396. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    396. 
            1409
            

            

                      @attribute_method_matchers_cache ||= Concurrent::Map.new(initial_capacity: 4)
          
      397. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    397. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      398. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    398. 
            
            

            

            
          
      399. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    399. 
            1
            

            

                    def attribute_method_matchers_matching(method_name)
          
      400. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    400. 
            1359
            

            

                      attribute_method_matchers_cache.compute_if_absent(method_name) do
          
      401. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    401. 
            44
            

            

                        attribute_method_matchers.map { |matcher| matcher.match(method_name) }.compact
          
      402. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    402. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      403. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    403. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      404. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    404. 
            
            

            

            
          
      405. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    405. 
            
            

            

                    # Define a method `name` in `mod` that dispatches to `send`
          
      406. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    406. 
            
            

            

                    # using the given `extra` args. This falls back on `define_method`
          
      407. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    407. 
            
            

            

                    # and `send` if the given names cannot be compiled.
          
      408. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    408. 
            1
            

            

                    def define_proxy_call(include_private, code_generator, name, target, *extra)
          
      409. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    409. 
            98
            

            

                      defn = if NAME_COMPILABLE_REGEXP.match?(name)
          
      410. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    410. 
            95
            

            

                        "def #{name}(*args)"
          
      411. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    411. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      412. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    412. 
            3
            

            

                        "define_method(:'#{name}') do |*args|"
          
      413. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    413. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      414. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    414. 
            
            

            

            
          
      415. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    415. 
            98
            

            

                      extra = (extra.map!(&:inspect) << "*args").join(", ")
          
      416. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    416. 
            
            

            

            
          
      417. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    417. 
            98
            

            

                      body = if CALL_COMPILABLE_REGEXP.match?(target)
          
      418. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    418. 
            97
            

            

                        "#{"self." unless include_private}#{target}(#{extra})"
          
      419. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    419. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      420. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    420. 
            1
            

            

                        "send(:'#{target}', #{extra})"
          
      421. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    421. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      422. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    422. 
            
            

            

            
          
      423. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    423. 
            
            

            

                      code_generator <<
          
      424. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    424. 
            
            

            

                        defn <<
          
      425. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    425. 
            
            

            

                        body <<
          
      426. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    426. 
            98
            

            

                        "end" <<
          
      427. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    427. 
            
            

            

                        "ruby2_keywords(:'#{name}') if respond_to?(:ruby2_keywords, true)"
          
      428.

                    end
          
      429.

            1
            

            

                    class AttributeMethodMatcher #:nodoc:
          
      431. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    431. 
            1
            

            

                      attr_reader :prefix, :suffix, :target
          
      432. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    432. 
            
            

            

            
          
      433. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    433. 
            1
            

            

                      AttributeMethodMatch = Struct.new(:target, :attr_name)
          
      434. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    434. 
            
            

            

            
          
      435. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    435. 
            1
            

            

                      def initialize(options = {})
          
      436. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    436. 
            33
            

            

                        @prefix, @suffix = options.fetch(:prefix, ""), options.fetch(:suffix, "")
          
      437. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    437. 
            33
            

            

                        @regex = /^(?:#{Regexp.escape(@prefix)})(.*)(?:#{Regexp.escape(@suffix)})$/
          
      438. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    438. 
            33
            

            

                        @target = "#{@prefix}attribute#{@suffix}"
          
      439. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    439. 
            33
            

            

                        @method_name = "#{prefix}%s#{suffix}"
          
      440. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    440. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      441. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    441. 
            
            

            

            
          
      442. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    442. 
            1
            

            

                      def match(method_name)
          
      443. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    443. 
            30
            

            

                        if @regex =~ method_name
          
      444. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    444. 
            19
            

            

                          AttributeMethodMatch.new(target, $1)
          
      445. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    445. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      446. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    446. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      447. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    447. 
            
            

            

            
          
      448. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    448. 
            1
            

            

                      def method_name(attr_name)
          
      449. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    449. 
            113
            

            

                        @method_name % attr_name
          
      450. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    450. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      451. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    451. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      452. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    452. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      453. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    453. 
            
            

            

            
          
      454. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    454. 
            
            

            

                # Allows access to the object attributes, which are held in the hash
          
      455. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    455. 
            
            

            

                # returned by <tt>attributes</tt>, as though they were first-class
          
      456. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    456. 
            
            

            

                # methods. So a +Person+ class with a +name+ attribute can for example use
          
      457. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    457. 
            
            

            

                # <tt>Person#name</tt> and <tt>Person#name=</tt> and never directly use
          
      458. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    458. 
            
            

            

                # the attributes hash -- except for multiple assignments with
          
      459. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    459. 
            
            

            

                # <tt>ActiveRecord::Base#attributes=</tt>.
          
      460. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    460. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      461. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    461. 
            
            

            

                # It's also possible to instantiate related objects, so a <tt>Client</tt>
          
      462. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    462. 
            
            

            

                # class belonging to the +clients+ table with a +master_id+ foreign key
          
      463. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    463. 
            
            

            

                # can instantiate master through <tt>Client#master</tt>.
          
      464. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    464. 
            1
            

            

                def method_missing(method, *args, &block)
          
      465. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    465. 
            9
            

            

                  if respond_to_without_attributes?(method, true)
          
      466. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    466. 
            2
            

            

                    super
          
      467. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    467. 
            
            

            

                  else
          
      468. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    468. 
            7
            

            

                    match = matched_attribute_method(method.to_s)
          
      469. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    469. 
            7
            

            

                    match ? attribute_missing(match, *args, &block) : super
          
      470. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    470. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      471. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    471. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      472. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    472. 
            1
            

            

                ruby2_keywords(:method_missing) if respond_to?(:ruby2_keywords, true)
          
      473. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    473. 
            
            

            

            
          
      474. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    474. 
            
            

            

                # +attribute_missing+ is like +method_missing+, but for attributes. When
          
      475. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    475. 
            
            

            

                # +method_missing+ is called we check to see if there is a matching
          
      476. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    476. 
            
            

            

                # attribute method. If so, we tell +attribute_missing+ to dispatch the
          
      477. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    477. 
            
            

            

                # attribute. This method can be overloaded to customize the behavior.
          
      478. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    478. 
            1
            

            

                def attribute_missing(match, *args, &block)
          
      479. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    479. 
            3
            

            

                  __send__(match.target, match.attr_name, *args, &block)
          
      480. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    480. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      481. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    481. 
            
            

            

            
          
      482. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    482. 
            
            

            

                # A +Person+ instance with a +name+ attribute can ask
          
      483. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    483. 
            
            

            

                # <tt>person.respond_to?(:name)</tt>, <tt>person.respond_to?(:name=)</tt>,
          
      484. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    484. 
            
            

            

                # and <tt>person.respond_to?(:name?)</tt> which will all return +true+.
          
      485. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    485. 
            1
            

            

                alias :respond_to_without_attributes? :respond_to?
          
      486. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    486. 
            1
            

            

                def respond_to?(method, include_private_methods = false)
          
      487. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    487. 
            1379
            

            

                  if super
          
      488. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    488. 
            25
            

            

                    true
          
      489. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    489. 
            1354
            

            

                  elsif !include_private_methods && super(method, true)
          
      490. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    490. 
            
            

            

                    # If we're here then we haven't found among non-private methods
          
      491. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    491. 
            
            

            

                    # but found among all methods. Which means that the given method is private.
          
      492. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    492. 
            2
            

            

                    false
          
      493. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    493. 
            
            

            

                  else
          
      494. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    494. 
            1352
            

            

                    !matched_attribute_method(method.to_s).nil?
          
      495. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    495. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      496. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    496. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      497. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    497. 
            
            

            

            
          
      498. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    498. 
            1
            

            

                private
          
      499. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    499. 
            1
            

            

                  def attribute_method?(attr_name)
          
      500. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    500. 
            1811
            

            

                    respond_to_without_attributes?(:attributes) && attributes.include?(attr_name)
          
      501. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    501. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      502. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    502. 
            
            

            

            
          
      503. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    503. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a struct representing the matching attribute method.
          
      504. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    504. 
            
            

            

                  # The struct's attributes are prefix, base and suffix.
          
      505. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    505. 
            1
            

            

                  def matched_attribute_method(method_name)
          
      506. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    506. 
            1359
            

            

                    matches = self.class.send(:attribute_method_matchers_matching, method_name)
          
      507. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    507. 
            3170
            

            

                    matches.detect { |match| attribute_method?(match.attr_name) }
          
      508. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    508. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      509. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    509. 
            
            

            

            
          
      510. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    510. 
            1
            

            

                  def missing_attribute(attr_name, stack)
          
      511. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    511. 
            
            

            

                    raise ActiveModel::MissingAttributeError, "missing attribute: #{attr_name}", stack
          
      512. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    512. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      513. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    513. 
            
            

            

            
          
      514. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    514. 
            1
            

            

                  def _read_attribute(attr)
          
      515. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    515. 
            67
            

            

                    __send__(attr)
          
      516. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    516. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      517. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    517. 
            
            

            

            
          
      518. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    518. 
            1
            

            

                  module AttrNames # :nodoc:
          
      519. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    519. 
            1
            

            

                    DEF_SAFE_NAME = /\A[a-zA-Z_]\w*\z/
          
      520. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    520. 
            
            

            

            
          
      521. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    521. 
            
            

            

                    # We want to generate the methods via module_eval rather than
          
      522. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    522. 
            
            

            

                    # define_method, because define_method is slower on dispatch.
          
      523. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    523. 
            
            

            

                    # Evaluating many similar methods may use more memory as the instruction
          
      524. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    524. 
            
            

            

                    # sequences are duplicated and cached (in MRI).  define_method may
          
      525. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    525. 
            
            

            

                    # be slower on dispatch, but if you're careful about the closure
          
      526. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    526. 
            
            

            

                    # created, then define_method will consume much less memory.
          
      527. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    527. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      528. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    528. 
            
            

            

                    # But sometimes the database might return columns with
          
      529. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    529. 
            
            

            

                    # characters that are not allowed in normal method names (like
          
      530. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    530. 
            
            

            

                    # 'my_column(omg)'. So to work around this we first define with
          
      531. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    531. 
            
            

            

                    # the __temp__ identifier, and then use alias method to rename
          
      532. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    532. 
            
            

            

                    # it to what we want.
          
      533. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    533. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      534. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    534. 
            
            

            

                    # We are also defining a constant to hold the frozen string of
          
      535. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    535. 
            
            

            

                    # the attribute name. Using a constant means that we do not have
          
      536. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    536. 
            
            

            

                    # to allocate an object on each call to the attribute method.
          
      537. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    537. 
            
            

            

                    # Making it frozen means that it doesn't get duped when used to
          
      538. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    538. 
            
            

            

                    # key the @attributes in read_attribute.
          
      539. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    539. 
            1
            

            

                    def self.define_attribute_accessor_method(owner, attr_name, writer: false)
          
      540. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    540. 
            10
            

            

                      method_name = "#{attr_name}#{'=' if writer}"
          
      541. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    541. 
            10
            

            

                      if attr_name.ascii_only? && DEF_SAFE_NAME.match?(attr_name)
          
      542. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    542. 
            10
            

            

                        yield method_name, "'#{attr_name}'"
          
      543. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    543. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      544. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    544. 
            
            

            

                        safe_name = attr_name.unpack1("h*")
          
      545. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    545. 
            
            

            

                        const_name = "ATTR_#{safe_name}"
          
      546. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    546. 
            
            

            

                        const_set(const_name, attr_name) unless const_defined?(const_name)
          
      547. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    547. 
            
            

            

                        temp_method_name = "__temp__#{safe_name}#{'=' if writer}"
          
      548. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    548. 
            
            

            

                        attr_name_expr = "::ActiveModel::AttributeMethods::AttrNames::#{const_name}"
          
      549. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    549. 
            
            

            

                        yield temp_method_name, attr_name_expr
          
      550. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    550. 
            
            

            

                        owner.rename_method(temp_method_name, method_name)
          
      551. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    551. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      552. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    552. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      553. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    553. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      554. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    554. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      555. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    555. 
            
            

            

            end

                  def clone_value(attr_name)

                  def assign_default_value(name)

    185.

      187.

            10
            

            

                      if value == NO_DEFAULT_PROVIDED
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            8
            

            

                        default_attribute = _default_attributes[name].with_type(type)
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                      else
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            2
            

            

                        default_attribute = Attribute::UserProvidedDefault.new(
          
      65.

                  def write_attribute(attr_name, value)

            module ActiveModel
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

              # == Active \Model \Callbacks
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

              # Provides an interface for any class to have Active Record like callbacks.
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

              # Like the Active Record methods, the callback chain is aborted as soon as
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

              # one of the methods throws +:abort+.
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

              # First, extend ActiveModel::Callbacks from the class you are creating:
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

              #   class MyModel
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

              #     extend ActiveModel::Callbacks
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

              #   end
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

              # Then define a list of methods that you want callbacks attached to:
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

              #   define_model_callbacks :create, :update
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

              # This will provide all three standard callbacks (before, around and after)
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

              # for both the <tt>:create</tt> and <tt>:update</tt> methods. To implement,
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

              # you need to wrap the methods you want callbacks on in a block so that the
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

              # callbacks get a chance to fire:
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

              #   def create
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

              #     run_callbacks :create do
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

              #       # Your create action methods here
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

              #     end
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

              #   end
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

              # Then in your class, you can use the +before_create+, +after_create+ and
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

              # +around_create+ methods, just as you would in an Active Record model.
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

              #   before_create :action_before_create
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

              #   def action_before_create
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

              #     # Your code here
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

              #   end
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

              # When defining an around callback remember to yield to the block, otherwise
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

              # it won't be executed:
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

              #  around_create :log_status
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

              #  def log_status
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

              #    puts 'going to call the block...'
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

              #    yield
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

              #    puts 'block successfully called.'
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

              #  end
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

              # You can choose to have only specific callbacks by passing a hash to the
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

              # +define_model_callbacks+ method.
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

              #   define_model_callbacks :create, only: [:after, :before]
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

              # Would only create the +after_create+ and +before_create+ callback methods in
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

              # your class.
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

              # NOTE: Calling the same callback multiple times will overwrite previous callback definitions.
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      65.

            1
            

            

              module Callbacks
          
      66.

            1
            

            

                def self.extended(base) #:nodoc:
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            18
            

            

                  base.class_eval do
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            18
            

            

                    include ActiveSupport::Callbacks
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

            
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                # define_model_callbacks accepts the same options +define_callbacks+ does,
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                # in case you want to overwrite a default. Besides that, it also accepts an
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                # <tt>:only</tt> option, where you can choose if you want all types (before,
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                # around or after) or just some.
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                #   define_model_callbacks :initializer, only: :after
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                # Note, the <tt>only: <type></tt> hash will apply to all callbacks defined
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                # on that method call. To get around this you can call the define_model_callbacks
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                # method as many times as you need.
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                #   define_model_callbacks :create,  only: :after
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                #   define_model_callbacks :update,  only: :before
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                #   define_model_callbacks :destroy, only: :around
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                # Would create +after_create+, +before_update+ and +around_destroy+ methods
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                # only.
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                # You can pass in a class to before_<type>, after_<type> and around_<type>,
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                # in which case the callback will call that class's <action>_<type> method
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                # passing the object that the callback is being called on.
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                #   class MyModel
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                #     extend ActiveModel::Callbacks
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                #     define_model_callbacks :create
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                #     before_create AnotherClass
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                #   end
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      101.

                #   class AnotherClass
          
      102.

                #     def self.before_create( obj )
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                #       # obj is the MyModel instance that the callback is being called on
          
      104.

                #     end
          
      105.

                #   end
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                # NOTE: +method_name+ passed to define_model_callbacks must not end with
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                # <tt>!</tt>, <tt>?</tt> or <tt>=</tt>.
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            1
            

            

                def define_model_callbacks(*callbacks)
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            7
            

            

                  options = callbacks.extract_options!
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            7
            

            

                  options = {
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                    skip_after_callbacks_if_terminated: true,
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                    scope: [:kind, :name],
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                    only: [:before, :around, :after]
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                  }.merge!(options)
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

            
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117.

                  def _define_before_model_callback(klass, callback)
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            5
            

            

                    klass.define_singleton_method("before_#{callback}") do |*args, **options, &block|
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            1
            

            

                      options.assert_valid_keys(:if, :unless, :prepend)
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            1

      133.

                  def _define_after_model_callback(klass, callback)
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            5
            

            

                    klass.define_singleton_method("after_#{callback}") do |*args, **options, &block|
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            5
            

            

                      options.assert_valid_keys(:if, :unless, :prepend)
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            5
            

            

                      options[:prepend] = true
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            5
            

            

                      conditional = ActiveSupport::Callbacks::Conditionals::Value.new { |v|
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            12
            

            

                        v != false
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                      }
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            5
            

            

                      options[:if] = Array(options[:if]) << conditional
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            5
            

            

                      set_callback(:"#{callback}", :after, *args, options, &block)
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153.

            module ActiveModel
