              # == Active \Model \Dirty
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

              # Provides a way to track changes in your object in the same way as
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

              # Active Record does.
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

              # The requirements for implementing ActiveModel::Dirty are:
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

              # * <tt>include ActiveModel::Dirty</tt> in your object.
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

              # * Call <tt>define_attribute_methods</tt> passing each method you want to
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

              #   track.
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

              # * Call <tt>[attr_name]_will_change!</tt> before each change to the tracked
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

              #   attribute.
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

              # * Call <tt>changes_applied</tt> after the changes are persisted.
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

              # * Call <tt>clear_changes_information</tt> when you want to reset the changes
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

              #   information.
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

              # * Call <tt>restore_attributes</tt> when you want to restore previous data.
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

              # A minimal implementation could be:
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

              #   class Person
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

              #     include ActiveModel::Dirty
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      28.

              #     define_attribute_methods :name
          
      29.

              #

              #     def initialize

              #     def reload!

              #       # get the values from the persistence layer
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

              #       clear_changes_information
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

              #     end
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

              #     def rollback!

    57. 
            
            

            

              #     end
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

              #   end
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

              # A newly instantiated +Person+ object is unchanged:
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

              #   person = Person.new
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

              #   person.changed? # => false
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

              # Change the name:
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name = 'Bob'
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

              #   person.changed?       # => true
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name_changed?  # => true
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name_changed?(from: nil, to: "Bob") # => true
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name_was       # => nil
          
      72.

              #   person.name_change    # => [nil, "Bob"]
          
      73.

              #   person.name = 'Bill'
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name_change    # => [nil, "Bill"]
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

              # Save the changes:
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      78.

      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

              #   person.changed?      # => false
          
      80.

              #   person.name_changed? # => false

              #   person.name_previously_changed? # => true

              #

              #

              #   person.name_changed? # => false
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

              # Assigning the same value leaves the attribute unchanged:
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name = 'Bill'
          
      102.

              #   person.name_changed? # => false
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name_change   # => nil
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

              # Which attributes have changed?
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name = 'Bob'
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

              #   person.changed # => ["name"]
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

              #   person.changes # => {"name" => ["Bill", "Bob"]}
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

              # If an attribute is modified in-place then make use of
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

              # <tt>[attribute_name]_will_change!</tt> to mark that the attribute is changing.
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

              # Otherwise \Active \Model can't track changes to in-place attributes. Note
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

              # that Active Record can detect in-place modifications automatically. You do
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

              # not need to call <tt>[attribute_name]_will_change!</tt> on Active Record models.
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name_will_change!
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name_change # => ["Bill", "Bill"]
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name << 'y'
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name_change # => ["Bill", "Billy"]
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            1
            

            

              module Dirty
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            1
            

            

                extend ActiveSupport::Concern
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            1
            

            

                include ActiveModel::AttributeMethods
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

            
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            1
            

            

                included do
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            2
            

            

                  attribute_method_suffix "_changed?", "_change", "_will_change!", "_was"
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            2
            

            

                  attribute_method_suffix "_previously_changed?", "_previous_change", "_previously_was"
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            2
            

            

                  attribute_method_affix prefix: "restore_", suffix: "!"
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            2
            

            

                  attribute_method_affix prefix: "clear_", suffix: "_change"
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

            
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            1
            

            

                def initialize_dup(other) # :nodoc:
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            1
            

            

                  super
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            1
            

            

                  if self.class.respond_to?(:_default_attributes)
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                    @attributes = self.class._default_attributes.map do |attr|
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                      attr.with_value_from_user(@attributes.fetch_value(attr.name))
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            1
            

            

                  @mutations_from_database = nil
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

            
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                # Clears dirty data and moves +changes+ to +previous_changes+ and
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                # +mutations_from_database+ to +mutations_before_last_save+ respectively.
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            1
            

            

                def changes_applied
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            25
            

            

                  unless defined?(@attributes)
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            12
            

            

                    mutations_from_database.finalize_changes
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            25
            

            

                  @mutations_before_last_save = mutations_from_database
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            25
            

            

                  forget_attribute_assignments
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            25
            

            

                  @mutations_from_database = nil
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

            
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                # Returns +true+ if any of the attributes has unsaved changes, +false+ otherwise.
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                #   person.changed? # => false
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                #   person.name = 'bob'
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                #   person.changed? # => true
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            1
            

            

                def changed?
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            18
            

            

                  mutations_from_database.any_changes?
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

            
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                # Returns an array with the name of the attributes with unsaved changes.
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                #

                def changed
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168.

                  mutations_from_database.changed_attribute_names

                end

                # Dispatch target for <tt>*_changed?</tt> attribute methods.
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            1
            

            

                def attribute_changed?(attr_name, **options) # :nodoc:
          
      173.

                end
          
      180.

    184. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

            
          
      186.

                # Dispatch target for <tt>*_previously_was</tt> attribute methods.

                def attribute_previously_was(attr_name) # :nodoc:
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                  mutations_before_last_save.original_value(attr_name.to_s)
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

            
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                # Restore all previous data of the provided attributes.
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            1
            

            

                def restore_attributes(attr_names = changed)
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            10
            

            

                  attr_names.each { |attr_name| restore_attribute!(attr_name) }
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

            
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

                # Clears all dirty data: current changes and previous changes.
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            1
            

            

                def clear_changes_information
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            2
            

            

                  @mutations_before_last_save = nil
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            2
            

            

                  forget_attribute_assignments
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            2
            

            

                  @mutations_from_database = nil
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

            
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            1
            

            

                def clear_attribute_changes(attr_names)
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                  attr_names.each do |attr_name|
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                    clear_attribute_change(attr_name)
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

            
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

                # Returns a hash of the attributes with unsaved changes indicating their original
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

                # values like <tt>attr => original value</tt>.
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

                #   person.name # => "bob"
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

                #   person.name = 'robert'
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

                #   person.changed_attributes # => {"name" => "bob"}
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            1
            

            

                def changed_attributes
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            10
            

            

                  mutations_from_database.changed_values
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

            
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                # Returns a hash of changed attributes indicating their original
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

                # and new values like <tt>attr => [original value, new value]</tt>.
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                #   person.changes # => {}
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

                #   person.name = 'bob'
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                #   person.changes # => { "name" => ["bill", "bob"] }
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            1
            

            

                def changes
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226.

                  mutations_from_database.changes
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

                end

      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

                # Returns a hash of attributes that were changed before the model was saved.
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

                #   person.name # => "bob"

                #   person.name = 'robert'

                #   person.save

                #   person.previous_changes # => {"name" => ["bob", "robert"]}
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            1
            

            

                def previous_changes
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            8
            

            

                  mutations_before_last_save.changes
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

            
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            1
            

            

                def attribute_changed_in_place?(attr_name) # :nodoc:
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                  mutations_from_database.changed_in_place?(attr_name.to_s)
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

            
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            1
            

            

                private
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            1
            

            

                  def clear_attribute_change(attr_name)
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            8
            

            

                    mutations_from_database.forget_change(attr_name.to_s)
          
      246.

                def detail

                    ActiveSupport::Deprecation.warn(<<~MSG)
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                      Enumerating ActiveModel::Errors as a hash has been deprecated.
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

                      In Rails 6.1, `errors` is an array of Error objects,
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

                      therefore it should be accessed by a block with a single block
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

                      parameter like this:
          
      244.

      248.

      249.

      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

                      You are passing a block expecting two parameters,
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251.

      252.

      253.

                # Returns a Hash of attributes with their error messages. If +full_messages+

            1
            

            

                def to_hash(full_messages = false)
          
      320. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    320. 
            114
            

            

                  hash = {}
          
      321. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    321. 
            114
            

            

                  message_method = full_messages ? :full_message : :message
          
      322. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    322. 
            114
            

            

                  group_by_attribute.each do |attribute, errors|
          
      323. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    323. 
            108
            

            

                    hash[attribute] = errors.map(&message_method)
          
      324. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    324. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      325. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    325. 
            114
            

            

                  hash
          
      326. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    326. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      327. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    327. 
            
            

            

            
          
      328. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    328. 
            1
            

            

                def to_h
          
      329. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    329. 
            1
            

            

                  ActiveSupport::Deprecation.warn(<<~EOM)
          
      330. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    330. 
            
            

            

                    ActiveModel::Errors#to_h is deprecated and will be removed in Rails 6.2.
          
      331. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    331. 
            
            

            

                    Please use `ActiveModel::Errors.to_hash` instead. The values in the hash
          
      332. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    332. 
            
            

            

                    returned by `ActiveModel::Errors.to_hash` is an array of error messages.
          
      333. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    333. 
            
            

            

                  EOM
          
      334. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    334. 
            
            

            

            
          
      335. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    335. 
            2
            

            

                  to_hash.transform_values { |values| values.last }
          
      336. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    336. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      337. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    337. 
            
            

            

            
          
      338. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    338. 
            
            

            

                # Returns a Hash of attributes with an array of their error messages.
          
      339. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    339. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      340. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    340. 
            
            

            

                # Updating this hash would still update errors state for backward
          
      341. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    341. 
            
            

            

                # compatibility, but this behavior is deprecated.
          
      342. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    342. 
            1
            

            

                def messages
          
      343.

            102
            

            

                  DeprecationHandlingMessageHash.new(self)

                # Returns a Hash of attributes with an array of their error details.

                #

                # Updating this hash would still update errors state for backward

                # compatibility, but this behavior is deprecated.
          
      350.

                def details
          
      351. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    351. 
            20
            

            

                  hash = {}
          
      352.

            20
            

            

                  group_by_attribute.each do |attribute, errors|

                # Returns a Hash of attributes with an array of their Error objects.

                #   # => {:name=>[<#ActiveModel::Error>, <#ActiveModel::Error>]}
          
      362.

            1
            

            

                def group_by_attribute
          
      363. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    363. 
            135
            

            

                  @errors.group_by(&:attribute)
          
      364.

                end
          
      365.

      366. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    366. 
            
            

            

                # Adds a new error of +type+ on +attribute+.
          
      367. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    367. 
            
            

            

                # More than one error can be added to the same +attribute+.
          
      368. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    368. 
            
            

            

                # If no +type+ is supplied, <tt>:invalid</tt> is assumed.
          
      369. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    369. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      370.

                #   person.errors.add(:name)

                #
          
      379. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    379. 
            
            

            

                # If +type+ is a string, it will be used as error message.
          
      380. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    380. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      381.

                # If +type+ is a symbol, it will be translated using the appropriate
          
      382.

                # scope (see +generate_message+).
          
      383.

                #
          
      384. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    384. 
            
            

            

                # If +type+ is a proc, it will be called, allowing for things like
          
      385. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    385. 
            
            

            

                # <tt>Time.now</tt> to be used within an error.
          
      386. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    386. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      387. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    387. 
            
            

            

                # If the <tt>:strict</tt> option is set to +true+, it will raise
          
      388. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    388. 
            
            

            

                # ActiveModel::StrictValidationFailed instead of adding the error.
          
      389. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    389. 
            
            

            

                # <tt>:strict</tt> option can also be set to any other exception.
          
      390.

                #
          
      391. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    391. 
            
            

            

                #   person.errors.add(:name, :invalid, strict: true)
          
      392. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    392. 
            
            

            

                #   # => ActiveModel::StrictValidationFailed: Name is invalid
          
      393.

                #   person.errors.add(:name, :invalid, strict: NameIsInvalid)

      395.

    396. 
            
            

            

                #   person.errors.messages # => {}
          
      397.

                #
          
      398. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    398. 
            
            

            

                # +attribute+ should be set to <tt>:base</tt> if the error is not
          
      399.

      400.

                def add(attribute, type = :invalid, **options)
          
      408. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    408. 
            669
            

            

                  attribute, type, options = normalize_arguments(attribute, type, **options)
          
      409. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    409. 
            669
            

            

                  error = Error.new(@base, attribute, type, **options)
          
      410. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    410. 
            
            

            

            
          
      411. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    411. 
            669
            

            

                  if exception = options[:strict]
          
      412. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    412. 
            6
            

            

                    exception = ActiveModel::StrictValidationFailed if exception == true
          
      413. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    413. 
            6
            

            

                    raise exception, error.full_message
          
      414. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    414. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      415. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    415. 
            
            

            

            
          
      416. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    416. 
            663
            

            

                  @errors.append(error)
          
      417. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    417. 
            
            

            

            
          
      418. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    418. 
            663
            

            

                  error
          
      419. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    419. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      420. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    420. 
            
            

            

            
          
      421. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    421. 
            
            

            

                # Returns +true+ if an error matches provided +attribute+ and +type+,
          
      422. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    422. 
            
            

            

                # or +false+ otherwise. +type+ is treated the same as for +add+.
          
      423. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    423. 
            
            

            

                #

    424. 
            
            

            

                #   person.errors.add :name, :blank

                #   person.errors.added? :name, :blank           # => true
          
      426.

      427. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    427. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      428.

                # If the error requires options, then it returns +true+ with
          
      429. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    429. 
            
            

            

                # the correct options, or +false+ with incorrect or missing options.
          
      430.

                #
          
      431.

                #   person.errors.add :name, :too_long, { count: 25 }

                def added?(attribute, type = :invalid, options = {})
          
      438. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    438. 
            28
            

            

                  attribute, type, options = normalize_arguments(attribute, type, **options)

      440.

                  if type.is_a? Symbol
          
      441.

                def full_messages_for(attribute)

                  where(attribute).map(&:full_message).freeze

                # Returns all the error messages for a given attribute in an array.

                def messages_for(attribute)

                # Returns a full message for a given attribute.

                #   person.errors.full_message(:name, 'is invalid') # => "Name is invalid"

                def full_message(attribute, message)
          
      517. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    517. 
            23
            

            

                  Error.full_message(attribute, message, @base.class)
          
      518. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    518. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      519. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    519. 
            
            

            

            
          
      520. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    520. 
            
            

            

                # Translates an error message in its default scope
          
      521. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    521. 
            
            

            

                # (<tt>activemodel.errors.messages</tt>).
          
      522. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    522. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      523. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    523. 
            
            

            

                # Error messages are first looked up in <tt>activemodel.errors.models.MODEL.attributes.ATTRIBUTE.MESSAGE</tt>,
          
      524. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    524. 
            
            

            

                # if it's not there, it's looked up in <tt>activemodel.errors.models.MODEL.MESSAGE</tt> and if
          
      525. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    525. 
            
            

            

                # that is not there also, it returns the translation of the default message
          
      526. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    526. 
            
            

            

                # (e.g. <tt>activemodel.errors.messages.MESSAGE</tt>). The translated model
          
      527. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    527. 
            
            

            

                # name, translated attribute name and the value are available for
          
      528. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    528. 
            
            

            

                # interpolation.
          
      529. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    529. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      530. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    530.

                  def prepare_content

    630.

    631. 
            106
            

            

                    content.default_proc = proc do |hash, attribute|
          
      632. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    632. 
            8
            

            

                      hash = hash.dup
          
      633. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    633. 
            8
            

            

                      hash[attribute] = DeprecationHandlingMessageArray.new([], @errors, attribute)
          
      634.

            8

                # == Active \Model \Lint \Tests
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

                # You can test whether an object is compliant with the Active \Model API by
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

                # including <tt>ActiveModel::Lint::Tests</tt> in your TestCase. It will
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                # include tests that tell you whether your object is fully compliant,
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                # or if not, which aspects of the API are not implemented.
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                # Note an object is not required to implement all APIs in order to work
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                # with Action Pack. This module only intends to provide guidance in case
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                # you want all features out of the box.
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                # These tests do not attempt to determine the semantic correctness of the
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                # returned values. For instance, you could implement <tt>valid?</tt> to
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                # always return +true+, and the tests would pass. It is up to you to ensure
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                # that the values are semantically meaningful.
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                # Objects you pass in are expected to return a compliant object from a call

                # to <tt>to_model</tt>. It is perfectly fine for <tt>to_model</tt> to return
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                # +self+.

            module ActiveModel
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

              # == Active \Model \Basic \Model
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

              # Includes the required interface for an object to interact with
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

              # Action Pack and Action View, using different Active Model modules.
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

              # It includes model name introspections, conversions, translations and
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

              # validations. Besides that, it allows you to initialize the object with a
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

              # hash of attributes, pretty much like Active Record does.
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

              # A minimal implementation could be:
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

              #   class Person
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

              #     include ActiveModel::Model
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

              #     attr_accessor :name, :age
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

              #   end
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

              #   person = Person.new(name: 'bob', age: '18')
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

              #   person.name # => "bob"
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

              #   person.age  # => "18"
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

              # Note that, by default, <tt>ActiveModel::Model</tt> implements <tt>persisted?</tt>
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

              # to return +false+, which is the most common case. You may want to override
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

              # it in your class to simulate a different scenario:
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

              #   class Person
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

              #     include ActiveModel::Model
          
      29.

              #     attr_accessor :id, :name
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

              #     def persisted?
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

              #       self.id == 1
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

              #     end
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

              #   end
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

              #   person = Person.new(id: 1, name: 'bob')
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

              #   person.persisted? # => true
          
      38.

      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                # :call-seq:
          
      147.

                # Equivalent to +to_s+.

            1
            

            

                delegate :==, :===, :<=>, :=~, :"!~", :eql?, :match?, :to_s,

                         :to_str, :as_json, to: :name

                # Returns a new ActiveModel::Name instance. By default, the +namespace+
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                # and +name+ option will take the namespace and name of the given class
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                # respectively.
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                #   module Foo
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                #     class Bar
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                #     end
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                #   end
          
      161.

                #
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                #   ActiveModel::Name.new(Foo::Bar).to_s
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                #   # => "Foo::Bar"
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            1
            

            

                def initialize(klass, namespace = nil, name = nil)
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            118
            

            

                  @name = name || klass.name
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

            
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            118
            

            

                  raise ArgumentError, "Class name cannot be blank. You need to supply a name argument when anonymous class given" if @name.blank?
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

            
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            117
            

            

                  @unnamespaced = @name.delete_prefix("#{namespace.name}::") if namespace
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            117
            

            

                  @klass        = klass
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            117
            

            

                  @singular     = _singularize(@name)
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            117
            

            

                  @plural       = ActiveSupport::Inflector.pluralize(@singular)
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            117
            

            

                  @element      = ActiveSupport::Inflector.underscore(ActiveSupport::Inflector.demodulize(@name))
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            117
            

            

                  @human        = ActiveSupport::Inflector.humanize(@element)
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            117
            

            

                  @collection   = ActiveSupport::Inflector.tableize(@name)
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            117
            

            

                  @param_key    = (namespace ? _singularize(@unnamespaced) : @singular)
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            117
            

            

                  @i18n_key     = @name.underscore.to_sym
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

            
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            117
            

            

                  @route_key          = (namespace ? ActiveSupport::Inflector.pluralize(@param_key) : @plural.dup)
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            117
            

            

                  @singular_route_key = ActiveSupport::Inflector.singularize(@route_key)
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            117
            

            

                  @route_key << "_index" if @plural == @singular
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

            
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                # Transform the model name into a more human format, using I18n. By default,
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                # it will underscore then humanize the class name.
          
      186.

      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                #   class BlogPost

                # Specify +options+ with additional translating options.
          
      194.

                def human(options = {})
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            571
            

            

                  return @human unless @klass.respond_to?(:lookup_ancestors) &&
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

                                       @klass.respond_to?(:i18n_scope)
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

            
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            519
            

            

                  defaults = @klass.lookup_ancestors.map do |klass|
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            572
            

            

                    klass.model_name.i18n_key
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

            
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            519
            

            

                  defaults << options[:default] if options[:default]
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            519
            

            

                  defaults << @human
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

            
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            519
            

            

                  options = { scope: [@klass.i18n_scope, :models], count: 1, default: defaults }.merge!(options.except(:default))
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            519
            

            

                  I18n.translate(defaults.shift, **options)
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

            
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            1
            

            

                private
          
      210.

                  def _singularize(string)
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            126
            

            

                    ActiveSupport::Inflector.underscore(string).tr("/", "_")
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

              end

              # Creates a +model_name+ method on your object.
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      219.

              # To implement, just extend ActiveModel::Naming in your object:
          
      220.

              #

              #   class BookCover
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

              #     extend ActiveModel::Naming
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

              #   end
          
      224.

              #

              #   BookModule::BookCover.model_name.i18n_key  # => :"book_module/book_cover"
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

              # Providing the functionality that ActiveModel::Naming provides in your object
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

              # is required to pass the \Active \Model Lint test. So either extending the
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

              # provided method below, or rolling your own is required.
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            1
            

            

              module Naming
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            1
            

            

                def self.extended(base) #:nodoc:
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            27
            

            

                  base.silence_redefinition_of_method :model_name
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            27
            

            

                  base.delegate :model_name, to: :class
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

            
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

                # Returns an ActiveModel::Name object for module. It can be
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

                # used to retrieve all kinds of naming-related information
          
      242.

                # (See ActiveModel::Name for more information).
          
      243.

                #
          
      244.

                #   class Person
          
      245.

                #     extend ActiveModel::Naming
          
      246.

                #   end

      252.

            1
            

            

                def model_name
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            3048
            

            

                  @_model_name ||= begin
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            84
            

            

                    namespace = module_parents.detect do |n|
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            158
            

            

                      n.respond_to?(:use_relative_model_naming?) && n.use_relative_model_naming?
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            84
            

            

                    ActiveModel::Name.new(self, namespace)
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

            
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

                # Returns the plural class name of a record or class.

                # Identifies whether the class name of a record or class is uncountable.

            1
            

            

                def self.uncountable?(record_or_class)
          
      282. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    282. 
            2
            

            

                  plural(record_or_class) == singular(record_or_class)

                # Returns string to use while generating route names. It differs for
          
      286.

                # namespaced models regarding whether it's inside isolated engine.

                def self.model_name_from_record_or_class(record_or_class) #:nodoc:
          
      325. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    325. 
            17
            

            

                  if record_or_class.respond_to?(:to_model)
          
      326. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    326. 
            6
            

            

                    record_or_class.to_model.model_name
          
      327.

                  else
          
      328. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    328. 
            11
            

            

                    record_or_class.model_name
          
      329. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    329.

                private_class_method :model_name_from_record_or_class

    lib/active_model/nested_error.rb

    100.0% lines covered

                # BCrypt hash function can handle maximum 72 bytes, and if we pass
          
      8.

                # password of length more than 72 bytes it ignores extra characters.

                  # Adds methods to set and authenticate against a BCrypt password.

                  # This mechanism requires you to have a +XXX_digest+ attribute.

    20. 
            
            

            

                  # Where +XXX+ is the attribute name of your desired password.
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      22.

                  # The following validations are added automatically:
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                  # * Password must be present on creation
          
      24.

                  # * Confirmation of password (using a +XXX_confirmation+ attribute)
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                  # If confirmation validation is not needed, simply leave out the
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                  # value for +XXX_confirmation+ (i.e. don't provide a form field for
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                  # it). When this attribute has a +nil+ value, the validation will not be
          
      30.

                      # This ensures the model has a password by checking whether the password_digest
          
      78.

                      # is present, so that this works with both new and existing records. However,
          
      79.

                      # when there is an error, the message is added to the password attribute instead

    20. 
            
            

            

              # Which would provide you with:
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

              #   person = Person.new
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

              #   person.serializable_hash   # => {"name"=>nil}
          
      24.
