              #   person.name = "Bob"
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

              #   person.serializable_hash   # => {"name"=>"Bob"}
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

              # An +attributes+ hash must be defined and should contain any attributes you
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

              # need to be serialized. Attributes must be strings, not symbols.
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

              # When called, serializable hash will use instance methods that match the name
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

              # of the attributes hash's keys. In order to override this behavior, take a look
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

              # at the private method +read_attribute_for_serialization+.
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

              # ActiveModel::Serializers::JSON module automatically includes
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

              # the <tt>ActiveModel::Serialization</tt> module, so there is no need to
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

              # explicitly include <tt>ActiveModel::Serialization</tt>.
          
      36.

              #

              # A minimal implementation including JSON would be:

                def serializable_hash(options = nil)
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            58
            

            

                  attribute_names = attributes.keys
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

            
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            58
            

            

                  return serializable_attributes(attribute_names) if options.blank?
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

            
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            39
            

            

                  if only = options[:only]
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            15
            

            

                    attribute_names &= Array(only).map(&:to_s)
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            24
            

            

                  elsif except = options[:except]
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            7
            

            

                    attribute_names -= Array(except).map(&:to_s)
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

            
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            39
            

            

                  hash = serializable_attributes(attribute_names)
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

            
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            49
            

            

                  Array(options[:methods]).each { |m| hash[m.to_s] = send(m) }
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

            
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            38
            

            

                  serializable_add_includes(options) do |association, records, opts|
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            16
            

            

                    hash[association.to_s] = if records.respond_to?(:to_ary)
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            28
            

            

                      records.to_ary.map { |a| a.serializable_hash(opts) }
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            5
            

            

                      records.serializable_hash(opts)
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

            
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            38
            

            

                  hash
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

            
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            1
            

            

                private
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                  # Hook method defining how an attribute value should be retrieved for
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  # serialization. By default this is assumed to be an instance named after
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                  # the attribute. Override this method in subclasses should you need to
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                  # retrieve the value for a given attribute differently:
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  #   class MyClass
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                  #     include ActiveModel::Serialization
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  #     def initialize(data = {})
          
      159.

                  #       @data = data
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                  #     end
          
      161.

                  #
          
      162.

                  #     def read_attribute_for_serialization(key)

                  #       @data[key]
          
      164.

      166.

            1
            

            

                  alias :read_attribute_for_serialization :send
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

            
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            1
            

            

                  def serializable_attributes(attribute_names)
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            221
            

            

                    attribute_names.index_with { |n| read_attribute_for_serialization(n) }
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

            
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                  # Add associations specified via the <tt>:include</tt> option.
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                  # Expects a block that takes as arguments:
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  #   +association+ - name of the association
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                  #   +records+     - the association record(s) to be serialized
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                  #   +opts+        - options for the association records
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            1
            

            

                  def serializable_add_includes(options = {}) #:nodoc:
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            38
            

            

                    return unless includes = options[:include]
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

            
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            13
            

            

                    unless includes.is_a?(Hash)
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            20
            

            

                      includes = Hash[Array(includes).flat_map { |n| n.is_a?(Hash) ? n.to_a : [[n, {}]] }]
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

            
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            13
            

            

                    includes.each do |association, opts|
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            16
            

            

                      if records = send(association)
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            16
            

            

                        yield association, records, opts
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      193.

              module Serializers

                # == Active \Model \JSON \Serializer

                module JSON
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            1
            

            

                  extend ActiveSupport::Concern
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            1
            

            

                  include ActiveModel::Serialization
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

            
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            1
            

            

                  included do
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            1
            

            

                    extend ActiveModel::Naming
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

            
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            1
            

            

                    class_attribute :include_root_in_json, instance_writer: false, default: false
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

            
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                  # Returns a hash representing the model. Some configuration can be
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                  # passed through +options+.
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                  # The option <tt>include_root_in_json</tt> controls the top-level behavior
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                  # of +as_json+. If +true+, +as_json+ will emit a single root node named
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                  # after the object's type. The default value for <tt>include_root_in_json</tt>
          
      24.

                  def from_json(json, include_root = include_root_in_json)
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            3
            

            

                    hash = ActiveSupport::JSON.decode(json)
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            3
            

            

                    hash = hash.values.first if include_root
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            3
            

            

                    self.attributes = hash
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            3
            

            

                    self
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      152.

                def lookup_ancestors

            23163

                # Transforms attribute names into a more human format, such as "First name"

                # Specify +options+ with additional translating options.

                def human_attribute_name(attribute, options = {})
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            586
            

            

                  options   = { count: 1 }.merge!(options)
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            586
            

            

                  parts     = attribute.to_s.split(".")
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            586
            

            

                  attribute = parts.pop
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            586
            

            

                  namespace = parts.join("/") unless parts.empty?
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            586
            

            

                  attributes_scope = "#{i18n_scope}.attributes"
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

            
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            586
            

            

                  if namespace
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            19
            

            

                    defaults = lookup_ancestors.map do |klass|
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53.

                # A class that behaves like a boolean type, including rules for coercion of user input.

                # === Coercion

                # Values set from user input will first be coerced into the appropriate ruby type.
          
      11.

                # Coercion behavior is roughly mapped to Ruby's boolean semantics.

                #
          
      13.

                # - "false", "f" , "0", +0+ or any other value in +FALSE_VALUES+ will be coerced to +false+

    14. 
            
            

            

                # - Empty strings are coerced to +nil+

    15. 
            
            

            

                # - All other values will be coerced to +true+
          
      16.

              #

              # Which provides you with the full standard validation stack that you
          
      23.

              # know from Active Record:
          
      24.

              #   person = Person.new
          
      26.

              #   person.valid?                   # => true

    27. 
            
            

            

              #   person.invalid?                 # => false
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

              #
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

              #   person.first_name = 'zoolander'
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

              #   person.valid?                   # => false
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

              #   person.invalid?                 # => true
          
      32.

              #   person.errors.messages          # => {first_name:["starts with z."]}
          
      33.

              #
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

              # Note that <tt>ActiveModel::Validations</tt> automatically adds an +errors+
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

              # method to your instances initialized with a new <tt>ActiveModel::Errors</tt>
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

              # object, so there is no need for you to do this manually.
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            1
            

            

              module Validations
          
      38.

            1
            

            

                extend ActiveSupport::Concern

      40.

            1
            

            

                included do
          
      41.

                  attr_accessor :validation_context
          
      49.

                  private :validation_context=
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            14
            

            

                  define_callbacks :validate, scope: :name
          
      51.

      52.

            367
            

            

                  class_attribute :_validators, instance_writer: false, default: Hash.new { |h, k| h[k] = [] }

                module ClassMethods
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                  # Validates each attribute against a block.
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Person
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                  #     include ActiveModel::Validations
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                  #     attr_accessor :first_name, :last_name
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                  #     validates_each :first_name, :last_name, allow_blank: true do |record, attr, value|
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  #       record.errors.add attr, "starts with z." if value.start_with?("z")
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                  #     end
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                  # Options:
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:on</tt> - Specifies the contexts where this validation is active.
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                  #   Runs in all validation contexts by default +nil+. You can pass a symbol
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                  #   or an array of symbols. (e.g. <tt>on: :create</tt> or
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>on: :custom_validation_context</tt> or
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>on: [:create, :custom_validation_context]</tt>)
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:allow_nil</tt> - Skip validation if attribute is +nil+.
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:allow_blank</tt> - Skip validation if attribute is blank.
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:if</tt> - Specifies a method, proc or string to call to determine
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                  #   if the validation should occur (e.g. <tt>if: :allow_validation</tt>,
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                  #   or <tt>if: Proc.new { |user| user.signup_step > 2 }</tt>). The method,
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                  #   proc or string should return or evaluate to a +true+ or +false+ value.
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:unless</tt> - Specifies a method, proc or string to call to
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                  #   determine if the validation should not occur (e.g. <tt>unless: :skip_validation</tt>,
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                  #   or <tt>unless: Proc.new { |user| user.signup_step <= 2 }</tt>). The
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                  #   method, proc or string should return or evaluate to a +true+ or +false+
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                  #   value.
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            1
            

            

                  def validates_each(*attr_names, &block)
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            2
            

            

                    validates_with BlockValidator, _merge_attributes(attr_names), &block
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

            
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            1
            

            

                  VALID_OPTIONS_FOR_VALIDATE = [:on, :if, :unless, :prepend].freeze # :nodoc:
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

            
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                  # Adds a validation method or block to the class. This is useful when
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                  # overriding the +validate+ instance method becomes too unwieldy and
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                  # you're looking for more descriptive declaration of your validations.
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                  # This can be done with a symbol pointing to a method:
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Comment
          
      98.

                  #     include ActiveModel::Validations

    99. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      100.

                  #     validate :must_be_friends
          
      101.

                  #

                  #

                  #

                  # Or with a block where self points to the current record to be validated:
          
      122.

                  #
          
      123.

                  #   class Comment
          
      124.

                  #     include ActiveModel::Validations

                  #

                  #     validate do
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                  #       errors.add(:base, 'Must be friends to leave a comment') unless commenter.friend_of?(commentee)
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                  #     end
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                  # Note that the return value of validation methods is not relevant.
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                  # It's not possible to halt the validate callback chain.
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                  # Options:
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:on</tt> - Specifies the contexts where this validation is active.
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                  #   Runs in all validation contexts by default +nil+. You can pass a symbol
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                  #   or an array of symbols. (e.g. <tt>on: :create</tt> or
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>on: :custom_validation_context</tt> or
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>on: [:create, :custom_validation_context]</tt>)
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:if</tt> - Specifies a method, proc or string to call to determine
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                  #   if the validation should occur (e.g. <tt>if: :allow_validation</tt>,
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                  #   or <tt>if: Proc.new { |user| user.signup_step > 2 }</tt>). The method,
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                  #   proc or string should return or evaluate to a +true+ or +false+ value.
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:unless</tt> - Specifies a method, proc or string to call to
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                  #   determine if the validation should not occur (e.g. <tt>unless: :skip_validation</tt>,
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                  #   or <tt>unless: Proc.new { |user| user.signup_step <= 2 }</tt>). The
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                  #   method, proc or string should return or evaluate to a +true+ or +false+
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                  #   value.
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                  # NOTE: Calling +validate+ multiple times on the same method will overwrite previous definitions.
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            1
            

            

                  def validate(*args, &block)
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            372
            

            

                    options = args.extract_options!
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

            
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            739
            

            

                    if args.all? { |arg| arg.is_a?(Symbol) }
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            15
            

            

                      options.each_key do |k|
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            7
            

            

                        unless VALID_OPTIONS_FOR_VALIDATE.include?(k)
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            1
            

            

                          raise ArgumentError.new("Unknown key: #{k.inspect}. Valid keys are: #{VALID_OPTIONS_FOR_VALIDATE.map(&:inspect).join(', ')}. Perhaps you meant to call `validates` instead of `validate`?")
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                        end
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                      end
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

            
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            371
            

            

                    if options.key?(:on)
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            11
            

            

                      options = options.dup
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            11
            

            

                      options[:on] = Array(options[:on])
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            11
            

            

                      options[:if] = Array(options[:if])
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            11
            

            

                      options[:if].unshift ->(o) {
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            38
            

            

                        !(options[:on] & Array(o.validation_context)).empty?
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                      }
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

            
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            371
            

            

                    set_callback(:validate, *args, options, &block)
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

            
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  # List all validators that are being used to validate the model using
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                  # +validates_with+ method.
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Person
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                  #     include ActiveModel::Validations
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

                  #     validates_with MyValidator
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                  #     validates_with OtherValidator, on: :create
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                  #     validates_with StrictValidator, strict: true
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                  #   Person.validators
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                  #   # => [
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      #<MyValidator:0x007fbff403e808 @options={}>,
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      #<OtherValidator:0x007fbff403d930 @options={on: :create}>,
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                  #   #      #<StrictValidator:0x007fbff3204a30 @options={strict:true}>
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                  #   #    ]
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            1
            

            

                  def validators
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            2
            

            

                    _validators.values.flatten.uniq
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

            
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

                  # Clears all of the validators and validations.

                  def inherited(base) #:nodoc:

    276. 
            158
            

            

                    dup = _validators.dup
          
      277. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    277. 
            158
            

            

                    base._validators = dup.each { |k, v| dup[k] = v.dup }

    278. 
            158
            

            

                    super
          
      279.

                def invalid?(context = nil)

                  !valid?(context)

                # Runs all the validations within the specified context. Returns +true+ if
          
      378. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    378. 
            
            

            

                # no errors are found, raises +ValidationError+ otherwise.
          
      379.

                #
          
      380. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    380. 
            
            

            

                # Validations with no <tt>:on</tt> option will run no matter the context. Validations with
          
      381. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    381. 
            
            

            

                # some <tt>:on</tt> option will only run in the specified context.
          
      382. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    382. 
            1
            

            

                def validate!(context = nil)
          
      383. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    383. 
            3
            

            

                  valid?(context) || raise_validation_error
          
      384.

                end

      386. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    386. 
            
            

            

                # Hook method defining how an attribute value should be retrieved. By default
          
      387.

                # this is assumed to be an instance named after the attribute. Override this
          
      388. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    388. 
            
            

            

                # method in subclasses should you need to retrieve the value for a given
          
      389. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    389. 
            
            

            

                # attribute differently:
          
      390.

                #   class MyClass

                  #   Also accepts an array of possible values. The default value is
          
      100.

                  #   an array ["1", true], which makes it easy to relate to an HTML
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                  #   checkbox. This should be set to, or include, +true+ if you are validating
          
      102.

                  #   a database column, since the attribute is typecast from "1" to +true+
          
      103.

      104.

              module Validations

                # == Active \Model \Validation \Callbacks
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            
            

            

                #
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
            

            

                # Provides an interface for any class to have +before_validation+ and
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

                # +after_validation+ callbacks.
          
      9.

                #
          
      10.

                    def option_call(record, name)

      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            1

                    def regexp_using_multiline_anchors?(regexp)
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            17
            

            

                      source = regexp.source
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            17
            

            

                      source.start_with?("^") || (source.end_with?("$") && !source.end_with?("\\$"))

                  #
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                  # Note: use <tt>\A</tt> and <tt>\z</tt> to match the start and end of the
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                  # string, <tt>^</tt> and <tt>$</tt> match the start/end of a line.
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                  # Due to frequent misuse of <tt>^</tt> and <tt>$</tt>, you need to pass
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                  # the <tt>multiline: true</tt> option in case you use any of these two
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                  # anchors in the provided regular expression. In most cases, you should be
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                  # using <tt>\A</tt> and <tt>\z</tt>.
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                  # You must pass either <tt>:with</tt> or <tt>:without</tt> as an option.
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                  # In addition, both must be a regular expression or a proc or lambda, or
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                  # else an exception will be raised.
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                  # Configuration options:
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:message</tt> - A custom error message (default is: "is invalid").
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:with</tt> - Regular expression that if the attribute matches will
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                  #   result in a successful validation. This can be provided as a proc or
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                  #   lambda returning regular expression which will be called at runtime.
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:without</tt> - Regular expression that if the attribute does not
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                  #   match will result in a successful validation. This can be provided as
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                  #   a proc or lambda returning regular expression which will be called at
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                  #   runtime.
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:multiline</tt> - Set to true if your regular expression contains
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                  #   anchors that match the beginning or end of lines as opposed to the
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                  #   beginning or end of the string. These anchors are <tt>^</tt> and <tt>$</tt>.
          
      104.

                  def validate_each(record, attribute, value)

                  # Validates that the specified attributes match the length restrictions

                  #

                  # * <tt>:minimum</tt> - The minimum size of the attribute.

                  # * <tt>:maximum</tt> - The maximum size of the attribute. Allows +nil+ by
          
      98.

                  #   default if not used with +:minimum+.
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:is</tt> - The exact size of the attribute.
          
      100.

                  # * <tt>:within</tt> - A range specifying the minimum and maximum size of
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                  #   the attribute.
          
      102.

                  # * <tt>:allow_nil</tt> - Attribute may be +nil+; skip validation.

    107. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:allow_blank</tt> - Attribute may be blank; skip validation.
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:too_long</tt> - The error message if the attribute goes over the
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                  #   maximum (default is: "is too long (maximum is %{count} characters)").
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:too_short</tt> - The error message if the attribute goes under the
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                  #   minimum (default is: "is too short (minimum is %{count} characters)").
          
      112.

                  # * <tt>:wrong_length</tt> - The error message if using the <tt>:is</tt>
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                  #   method and the attribute is the wrong size (default is: "is the wrong
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                  #   length (should be %{count} characters)").
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115.

      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>:maximum</tt>, or <tt>:is</tt> violation. An alias of the appropriate
          
      117.

                  def record_attribute_changed_in_place?(record, attr_name)
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            488
            

            

                    record.respond_to?(:attribute_changed_in_place?) &&

                module HelperMethods
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                  # Validates whether the value of the specified attribute is numeric by
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                  # trying to convert it to a float with Kernel.Float (if <tt>only_integer</tt>
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                  # is +false+) or applying it to the regular expression <tt>/\A[\+\-]?\d+\z/</tt>
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                  # (if <tt>only_integer</tt> is set to +true+). Precision of Kernel.Float values
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                  # are guaranteed up to 15 digits.
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Person < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                  #     validates_numericality_of :value, on: :create
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  # Configuration options:
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:message</tt> - A custom error message (default is: "is not a number").
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:only_integer</tt> - Specifies whether the value has to be an
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                  #   integer, e.g. an integral value (default is +false+).
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:allow_nil</tt> - Skip validation if attribute is +nil+ (default is
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                  #   +false+). Notice that for Integer and Float columns empty strings are
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                  #   converted to +nil+.
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:greater_than</tt> - Specifies the value must be greater than the
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                  #   supplied value.
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:greater_than_or_equal_to</tt> - Specifies the value must be
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                  #   greater than or equal the supplied value.
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:equal_to</tt> - Specifies the value must be equal to the supplied
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                  #   value.
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:less_than</tt> - Specifies the value must be less than the
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                  #   supplied value.
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:less_than_or_equal_to</tt> - Specifies the value must be less
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            
            

            

                  #   than or equal the supplied value.
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:other_than</tt> - Specifies the value must be other than the
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                  #   supplied value.
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:odd</tt> - Specifies the value must be an odd number.
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:even</tt> - Specifies the value must be an even number.
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  # There is also a list of default options supported by every validator:
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                  # +:if+, +:unless+, +:on+, +:allow_nil+, +:allow_blank+, and +:strict+ .
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  # See <tt>ActiveModel::Validations#validates</tt> for more information
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  # The following checks can also be supplied with a proc or a symbol which
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                  # corresponds to a method:
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:greater_than</tt>
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:greater_than_or_equal_to</tt>
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:equal_to</tt>
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:less_than</tt>
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:less_than_or_equal_to</tt>
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:only_integer</tt>
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                  # For example:
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                  #   class Person < ActiveRecord::Base
          
      188.

                  #     validates_numericality_of :width, less_than: ->(person) { person.height }
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                  #     validates_numericality_of :width, greater_than: :minimum_weight
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            1
            

            

                  def validates_numericality_of(*attr_names)
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            73
            

            

                    validates_with NumericalityValidator, _merge_attributes(attr_names)
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                end

              end

                  # Validates that the specified attributes are not blank (as defined by
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                  # Object#blank?). Happens by default on save.
          
      14.

                  #   end

                  #
          
      19.

                  # The first_name attribute must be in the object and it cannot be blank.
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                  # If you want to validate the presence of a boolean field (where the real
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                  # values are +true+ and +false+), you will want to use
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>validates_inclusion_of :field_name, in: [true, false]</tt>.
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                  # This is due to the way Object#blank? handles boolean values:
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                  # <tt>false.blank? # => true</tt>.
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                  # Configuration options:
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:message</tt> - A custom error message (default is: "can't be blank").
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                  # There is also a list of default options supported by every validator:
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

                  # +:if+, +:unless+, +:on+, +:allow_nil+, +:allow_blank+, and +:strict+.
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

                  # See <tt>ActiveModel::Validations#validates</tt> for more information
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            1
            

            

                  def validates_presence_of(*attr_names)
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            34
            

            

                    validates_with PresenceValidator, _merge_attributes(attr_names)

                module ClassMethods

                  # This method is a shortcut to all default validators and any custom
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                  # validator classes ending in 'Validator'. Note that Rails default
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                  # validators can be overridden inside specific classes by creating
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                  # custom validator classes in their place such as PresenceValidator.
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                  # Examples of using the default rails validators:
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            
            

            

                  #   validates :username, absence: true
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                  #   validates :terms, acceptance: true
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                  #   validates :password, confirmation: true
          
      18.

                  #   validates :username, exclusion: { in: %w(admin superuser) }

                  #   validates :email, format: { with: /\A([^@\s]+)@((?:[-a-z0-9]+\.)+[a-z]{2,})\z/i, on: :create }
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                  #   validates :age, inclusion: { in: 0..9 }

                  #   validates :first_name, length: { maximum: 30 }

                  #   validates :age, numericality: true

                  #   validates :username, presence: true

                  #
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

                  # The power of the +validates+ method comes when using custom validators
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                  # and default validators in one call for a given attribute.
          
      27.

                  #

                  #   class EmailValidator < ActiveModel::EachValidator

                  #     def validate_each(record, attribute, value)

                  # Validator classes may also exist within the class being validated

    44. 
            
            

            

                  # allowing custom modules of validators to be included as needed.

                  #     class TitleValidator < ActiveModel::EachValidator

                  #       def validate_each(record, attribute, value)
          
      51.

                  #         record.errors.add attribute, "must start with 'the'" unless /\Athe/i.match?(value)

                  #
