                  #     validates :name, title: true
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                  #   end
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                  # Additionally validator classes may be in another namespace and still
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                  # used within any class.
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                  #   validates :name, :'film/title' => true
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                  # The validators hash can also handle regular expressions, ranges, arrays
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  # and strings in shortcut form.
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                  #   validates :email, format: /@/
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

                  #   validates :role, inclusion: %w(admin contributor)
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            
            

            

                  #   validates :password, length: 6..20
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                  # When using shortcut form, ranges and arrays are passed to your
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                  # validator's initializer as <tt>options[:in]</tt> while other types
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

                  # including regular expressions and strings are passed as <tt>options[:with]</tt>.
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

                  # There is also a list of options that could be used along with validators:
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:on</tt> - Specifies the contexts where this validation is active.
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

                  #   Runs in all validation contexts by default +nil+. You can pass a symbol
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
            

            

                  #   or an array of symbols. (e.g. <tt>on: :create</tt> or
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>on: :custom_validation_context</tt> or
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>on: [:create, :custom_validation_context]</tt>)
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:if</tt> - Specifies a method, proc or string to call to determine
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

                  #   if the validation should occur (e.g. <tt>if: :allow_validation</tt>,
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            
            

            

                  #   or <tt>if: Proc.new { |user| user.signup_step > 2 }</tt>). The method,
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                  #   proc or string should return or evaluate to a +true+ or +false+ value.
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:unless</tt> - Specifies a method, proc or string to call to determine
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

                  #   if the validation should not occur (e.g. <tt>unless: :skip_validation</tt>,
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                  #   or <tt>unless: Proc.new { |user| user.signup_step <= 2 }</tt>). The
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                  #   method, proc or string should return or evaluate to a +true+ or
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                  #   +false+ value.
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:allow_nil</tt> - Skip validation if the attribute is +nil+.
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:allow_blank</tt> - Skip validation if the attribute is blank.
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:strict</tt> - If the <tt>:strict</tt> option is set to true
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                  #   will raise ActiveModel::StrictValidationFailed instead of adding the error.
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>:strict</tt> option can also be set to any other exception.
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                  # Example:
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                  #   validates :password, presence: true, confirmation: true, if: :password_required?
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                  #   validates :token, length: 24, strict: TokenLengthException
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                  #
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                  # Finally, the options +:if+, +:unless+, +:on+, +:allow_blank+, +:allow_nil+, +:strict+
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                  # and +:message+ can be given to one specific validator, as a hash:
          
      104.

                  def validates(*attributes)

                  def validates!(*attributes)

                  def _parse_validates_options(options)

                    case options

            22

      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            11
            

            

                      options
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                    when Range, Array
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            2
            

            

                      { in: options }
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            5

      171.

      172.

                  # Configuration options:
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:on</tt> - Specifies the contexts where this validation is active.
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                  #   Runs in all validation contexts by default +nil+. You can pass a symbol
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                  #   or an array of symbols. (e.g. <tt>on: :create</tt> or
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                  #   <tt>on: :custom_validation_context</tt> or

                  #   <tt>on: [:create, :custom_validation_context]</tt>)
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:if</tt> - Specifies a method, proc or string to call to determine
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                  #   if the validation should occur (e.g. <tt>if: :allow_validation</tt>,
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                  #   or <tt>if: Proc.new { |user| user.signup_step > 2 }</tt>).
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  #   The method, proc or string should return or evaluate to a +true+ or
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                  #   +false+ value.
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                  # * <tt>:unless</tt> - Specifies a method, proc or string to call to
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                  #   determine if the validation should not occur
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                  #   (e.g. <tt>unless: :skip_validation</tt>, or
          
      62.

      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                  #   The method, proc or string should return or evaluate to a +true+ or
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  #   +false+ value.

                def validates_with(*args, &block)

    138. 
            2

            2

    140. 
            
            

            

            
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            2

      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            2

                attr_reader :attributes

      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                # Returns a new validator instance. All options will be available via the
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                # +options+ reader, however the <tt>:attributes</tt> option will be removed
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                # and instead be made available through the +attributes+ reader.
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            1
            

            

                def initialize(options)
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            366
            

            

                  @attributes = Array(options.delete(:attributes))
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            366
            

            

                  raise ArgumentError, ":attributes cannot be blank" if @attributes.empty?
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            365
            

            

                  super
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            365
            

            

                  check_validity!
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143.

                # Performs validation on the supplied record. By default this will call
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                # +validate_each+ to determine validity therefore subclasses should
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                # override +validate_each+ with validation logic.
          
      148.

            1
            

            

                def validate(record)
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            900
            

            

                  attributes.each do |attribute|
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            939
            

            

                    value = read_attribute_for_validation(record, attribute)
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            939
            

            

                    next if (value.nil? && options[:allow_nil]) || (value.blank? && options[:allow_blank])
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            902
            

            

                    validate_each(record, attribute, value)
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

            
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                # Override this method in subclasses with the validation logic, adding
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                # errors to the records +errors+ array where necessary.
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158.

                def validate_each(record, attribute, value)
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

                  raise NotImplementedError, "Subclasses must implement a validate_each(record, attribute, value) method"
          
      160.

                end

                # Hook method that gets called by the initializer allowing verification
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

                # that the arguments supplied are valid. You could for example raise an
          
      164.

                # +ArgumentError+ when invalid options are supplied.
          
      165.

                private
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            1
            

            

                  def read_attribute_for_validation(record, attr_name)
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            937
            

            

                    record.read_attribute_for_validation(attr_name)
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

            
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

              # +BlockValidator+ is a special +EachValidator+ which receives a block on initialization
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

              # and call this block for each attribute being validated. +validates_each+ uses this validator.
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            1
            

            

              class BlockValidator < EachValidator #:nodoc:
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            1
